7. The integral of a constant function is always zero. (True/False)

9. Integration can be used to find the velocity of an object given its acceleration. (True/False)
10. Integration can be used to find the average value of a function over a given interval. (True/False)
11. The integration of a constant multiplied by a function is equivalent to multiplying the constant with the integrated function. (True/False)
12. The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus states that differentiation and integration are inverse operations. (True/False)
13. The integral of a function represents the rate of change of that function. (True/False)
14. Integration can be used to find the volume of a solid of revolution. (True/False)
15. The integration of a sum of functions is equivalent to the sum of the integrals of each individual function. (True/False)
16. The integral of the derivative of a function is equal to the original function. (True/False)
17. Integration can be used to find the accumulation of a quantity over time. (True/False)
18. The interval of integration determines the limits of the integration process. (True/False)
19. Integration can be used to solve differential equations. (True/False)
20. Integration is only applicable to continuous functions. (True/False)
